Justification: Buttigieg was a Navy intelligence officer in Afghanistan for six months. There are several photos of him in uniform and accounts of his service online. A false conspiracy alleging he never served in the military originated on a fringe internet platform known for disinformation and hate speech.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Cocaine kills corona virus, scientists is shocked to discover that this drug can fight the virus.”
Justification: This "breaking news" image is from an online news generator and not based on any real news coverage. There is still no vaccine or medical treatment for the 2019 Novel Coronavirus.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says a "Clorox bottle claimed it could kill (the 2019 coronavirus)... before it was developed."
Justification: N/A
Sources: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says Nancy Pelosi was arrested after ripping a copy of the State of the Union speech.
Justification: Nancy Pelosi was not arrested for ripping up Donald Trump’s State of the Union speech. Legal experts say her actions weren’t illegal.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: "If Trump is impeached in the house & not senate, he can run 2 more times."
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says photos show Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton and Condoleezza Rice posing with Osama bin Laden.
Justification: Photos showing Obama, Clinton and Rice with Osama bin Laden were altered.
Sources: "African American Attorneys In Hawaii" on Google Books
Various reverse image searches on Google

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says image shows Pete Buttigieg in a leather suit posing with two other men.
Justification: Image is edited and not a real picture of Pete Buttigieg. The Facebook photo was edited to replace the face of the person originally in the photo with an image of Buttigieg’s face.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Starbucks CEO Has Admitted She Doesnt Like White People”
Justification: Rosalind Brewer said her executive team at Sam’s Club (where she worked before joining Starbucks) was diverse, and said she tries to use her platform to set an example and encourage diversity in the workforce. Brewer is Starbucks’ chief operating officer and group president, not the CEO.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “President Trump signs bill returning prayer in schools.”
Justification: President Donald Trump announced guidance for school prayer in January. Trump’s guidance is similar to 2003 guidance from President George W. Bush. Government-sponsored prayer in public schools has been unconstitutional for decades.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “The KKK officially endorses Trump 2020.”
Justification: A post shared on Facebook shows Trump next to two people who appear to be wearing Ku Klux Klan garb and carries a headline saying the KKK endorses his re-election. The post is from an article on a website that says it publishes only satire. A photo of Trump with hooded klansmen was made by an artist who poses celebrity lookalikes for her work.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says former NBA player Rick Fox was also on board with Kobe Bryant
Justification: Misinformation about the identities of the victims of the Kobe Bryant helicopter crash has spread online. Despite early reports that said he was involved, former NBA player Rick Fox wasn't among those killed in the crash. His stepdaughter confirmed that he wasn't on board.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says Kate Spade worked with the Clintons and suggests they were involved in her death.
Justification: Kate Spade’s brand, Kate Spade New York, was one of several brands that participated in two Clinton Foundation events years after the designer sold her stake in the company. There is no evidence the Clinton’s were involved in Spade’s death, which was ruled a suicide.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says the 2019 coronavirus "causes sudden death syndrome."
Justification: The 2019 coronavirus has killed 1,017 people in China. There is no evidence that the virus causes sudden death syndrome.
Sources: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: "CORONAVIRUS: Reports of 10,000 DEAD in Wuhan, China."
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Epstein’s recruiter Ghislaine Maxwell’s father Robert Maxwell gave Mitt Romney his first $2M investment and started him in business.”
Justification: Sen. Mitt Romney of Utah had eight years of business experience before co-founding the Bain Capital investment firm in 1984. British publisher Robert Maxwell was among the early investors in Romney’s first investment fund at Bain. Romney had already established himself in business by the time Robert Maxwell gave him money — and Maxwell’s investment was not the first in the fund. Robert Maxwell died before his daughter began working with Epstein. So any alleged connection between Romney and Epstein lacks evidence.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says a teenage Pete Buttigieg was arrested in the late 1990s for killing dogs.
Justification: The newspaper clipping is fake and was created by a Twitter user who later said it was intended as a joke. The alleged source of the phony article, the South Bend Tribune, published a response calling it "bogus."

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Trump just cut the scheduled federal pay raise, stating that he can’t do it now because of ‘serious economic conditions’ in America.”
Justification: Civilian federal employees were scheduled to get pay raises of 2.5% in January 2021, but Trump reduced the raises to 1%. He cited a law that allows him to make the change based on "serious economic conditions."

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “When using a medical mask you’re supposed to use… white side out (this is the filter part) for when you’re not sick.”
Justification: Global health agencies and medical mask producers agree that the colored side of the mask should always be worn on the outside.
Sources: San Francisco Department of Public Health

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Michigan prosecutor looks to release 90 convicted murderers serving life sentences.”
Justification: A county prosecutor in Michigan said she’s reviewing the cases of 90 convicted murderers who are serving life sentences without parole to consider whether to recommend them for release. In Michigan, only the governor can commute inmates’ sentences if they are recommended for release by the state parole board. The prosecutor indicated to a local newspaper that only a few inmates are likely to be recommended for release.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: The widow and son of a deceased military veteran looked on in horror as Speaker Nancy Pelosi ripped up a copy of the State of the Union.
Justification: Army Staff Sgt. Christopher Hake was killed in 2008 by a roadside bomb in Iraq. He and his family were recognized during the 2020 State of the Union. An emotional photo of Sgt. Hake’s widow and son was taken during the address, not when Nancy Pelosi ripped up a copy of the speech at the conclusion.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says the Democratic Party "took Social Security from the independent ‘Trust Fund’ and put it into the general fund so that Congress could spend it" and "eliminated the income tax deduction for Social Security (FICA) withholding."
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” Novel coronavirus outbreak
Justification: The toy at the center of the controversy is supposed to be a coronavirus microbe. Event 201 offered the plushies to people who registered to attend an October 2019 gathering that was designed to help plan for a global pandemic by bringing together business, government, and public health leaders. Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China. Microbe plushies representing a number of diseases are widely available for sale. The Event 201 plushies were not intended to commemorate the toll that the coming outbreak would bring. Our rating is Mostly False.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says George Soros was an “SS in the National Socialist German Workers Party. Nazi Party.”
Justification: The photo isn’t of Soros. It’s of Oskar Gröning, a former SS soldier who died in 2018. Soros, a Holocaust survivor, was not a member of the Nazi Party.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: After pushing through a red flag law in the New Mexico Senate, Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham “has had the firearms of her guards and household seized.”
Justification: New Mexico Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham supports a red flag law that passed the state Senate and House.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: "Virginia Democrats Push Legislation to Make Criticism of Government Officials a Criminal Offense."
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: “Trump’s daughter works at the White House. Her husband works at the White House. Rudy’s son works at the White House. Barr’s son-in-law works at the White House. Barr’s daughter works at Treasury. Trump’s sons do foreign business. Trump’s daughter is getting Chinese patents and Saudi grants.”
Justification: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner work in the White House along with Giuliani’s son and Barr’s son-in-law. Barr’s oldest daughter works in the Treasury Department. Eric and Donald Trump Jr. have continued conducting international business on behalf of the Trump Organization. Ivanka Trump accepted Chinese trademarks related to her fashion business. The Saudi grants in question went to a World Bank fund she helped inspire, not to her.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Say Nancy Pelosi’s net worth is $196,299,990.
Justification: The $196 million figure is likely too high.  Congressional disclosure forms don’t provide a precise number, but the midpoint of estimates produces a net worth for Pelosi of $97 million, which is a fraction of the number claimed in the meme. Pelosi’s husband Paul is a businessman in real estate and venture capital, and the couple’s net worth stems largely from his investments. The meme’s salary figure for Nancy Pelosi isn’t accurate, either.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says Paul Walker was set to come forward to expose “Clinton Foundation crimes against children in Haiti” before he was killed.
Justification: There is no evidence the car Walker died in was tampered with. The coroner reported it was traveling near 100 mph when it crashed. The only connection between Walker and the Clinton Foundation is that both were involved in relief efforts in Haiti. The rest is speculation.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says a 392-year-old shark was discovered in the Arctic Ocean
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says a series of photos show Iranian rockets being launched toward U.S. air bases in Iraq.
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says a video shows Iranian rockets being launched toward a U.S. air base in Iraq.
Justification: N/A

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: Says Kobe Bryant and his daughter, Gianna, were both born Aug. 23.
Justification: Facebook post has correct information for Kobe Bryant, but incorrect birthday for his daughter, Gianna.

Speaker: facebook-posts
Main Claim: In 1988, in response to Iran’s attack on the U.S.S. Samuel Roberts, President Ronald Reagan "destroyed half of Iran’s Navy."
Justification: N/A
Sources: "Command at Sea: Naval Command and Control since the Sixteenth Century

Main Claim: Florida is "the 45th in state education funding."
Justification: Education Week’sQuality Counts reportreleased in June showed Florida received an F grade for spending, ranking it 45th in that category. The states that ranked lower than Florida were Tennessee, Oklahoma, North Carolina, Idaho, Utah and Arizona. Florida also ranks near the bottom for the sub-category of per-pupil spending alone.

Justification: It's not illegal for Californians to shower and wash laundry on the same day. New California laws instruct water districts to establish strict water budgets, but they don't target individuals with fines. We debunked the same misinformation in 2018.
